title: Tory Lanez sentenced to 10 years for Megan Thee Stallion shooting
description: The rapper was convicted of shooting Megan Thee Stallion in July 2020 as they left a party in Los Angeles. Prosecutors argued that Tory Lanez had tried to turn public opinion against the plaintiff.

title: Shakespeare and penguin book get caught in Florida's 'Don't Say Gay' laws
description: Students in a Florida school district will be reading only excerpts from William Shakespeare's plays for class rather than the full texts under redesigned curriculum guides.

title: What we know — and don't know — about the FDA-approved postpartum depression pill
description: Postpartum depression affects as many as 1 in 7 women in the U.S., though there are just two treatments approved for it. Experts say the newest could be a game-changer — depending on its price tag.

title: From drone videos to selfies at the front, Ukraine is the most documented war ever
description: NPR's Greg Myre has covered more than a dozen wars dating back to the 1980s. He says the conflict in Ukraine is the most documented war ever, providing a view we've never had before.

title: As a writer slowly loses his sight, he embraces other kinds of perception
description: Andrew Leland started losing his sight 20 years ago. He's now legally blind, although he still has a narrow field of vision, which allows him to see about 6% of what a fully-sighted person sees.

title: He was a top church official who criticized Trump. He says Christianity is in crisis
description: Russell Moore criticized Donald Trump and the Southern Baptist Convention's response to a sexual abuse crisis. Then he found himself on the outside.

title: Uvalde shooter's cousin arrested in San Antonio for threatening to shoot a school
description: Nathan James Cruz, 17, was arrested on charges of making a terroristic threat and making a terroristic threat against his family. His mother reported his statements to police.

title: DJ Casper, creator of the iconic and ubiquitous 'Cha Cha Slide,' has died at 58
description: The Chicago native, born Willie Perry Jr., wrote the song as an exercise track for his nephew in the late 1990s before it exploded in popularity and became a worldwide hit.

title: Powerful storms killed 2 people and left more than 1 million customers without power
description: A severe summer storm system swept from Alabama to New York on Monday, leaving a trail of toppled trees, damaged buildings and transportation headaches in its wake.

title: A new clue to the reason some people come down with long COVID
description: Researchers have found a link between the FOXP4 gene and the occurrence of what's known as long COVID. The finding could lead to a better understanding of a condition that affects millions.

title: Prebiotic sodas promise to boost your gut health. Here's what to eat instead
description: You don't have to shell out for fancy sodas. It's easy to fill your plate with fiber, a dietary hero that feeds your gut microbes and prevents disease.

title: Up First Briefing: Biden's Grand Canyon national monument; health tips from Japan.
description: Biden will designate a national monument protecting Indigenous land near the Grand Canyon. NPR's Yuki Noguchi has lessons from Japan about healthy living.

title: How many voters does it take to make a majority? Why Ohio's Issue 1 is controversial
description: Voters in Ohio will decide on Tuesday whether to make it harder to pass future constitutional amendments, including one on the ballot in November that would codify abortion access.

title: Biden is creating a new national monument near the Grand Canyon
description: The president will make the announcement in Arizona on Tuesday. The designation protects lands that are sacred to indigenous peoples and blocks new uranium mine claims.

title: New national monument comes after more than a decade of advocacy by Native nations
description: The new national monument that President Biden is designating in Arizona today comes after Native nations advocated for decades to protect the area

title: There's money in Magic: The booming business of rare game cards
description: For decades, sports have led the pack in the trading card market. Now, as celebrities shell out millions for rare game cards, fantasy characters are giving star athletes a run for their money.

title: Tuesday's Mega Millions now at $1.55 billion, the 3rd-largest in U.S. lottery history
description: The massive Mega Millions prize now ranks as the third-largest jackpot in U.S. history. Mega Millions jackpot winners are rare thanks to odds of 1 in 302.6 million.
